message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.SD 

The paper deals with the problem of context-sensitive classification, which is a common problem in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The paper presents general strategies for enhancing the performance of classification algorithms on this type of problem, which suggests that it belongs to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The two domains tested in the paper, gas turbine engine diagnosis and speech recognition, involve signal processing and natural language processing, respectively, which suggests that it could also belong to the signal processing (cs.SD) and computational linguistics (cs.CL) sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions the use of image processing techniques for feature extraction in the gas turbine engine diagnosis domain, which suggests that it could also belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category.
